name: 16 gauge Birbshot
description: The 16 gauge round is very comparable to the 12 gauge in preformamce. The 16 gauge is lighter and has less recoil, buut it is very seldomly used due to various reasons the one mostly considered is the change to steel loads for waterfowl hunting. This one is a load for birds. It would be a wise idea to use this for animals no bigger than a coyote.

name: 16 gauge Slug
description: The 16 gauge round is very comparable to the 12 gauge in preformamce. The 16 gauge is lighter and has less recoil, buut it is very seldomly used due to various reasons the one mostly considered is the change to steel loads for waterfowl hunting. This one is a slug and is a very good idea to use for self defense. It hits hard and penetrates. Make sure to get used to shotguns before firing a slug because they tend to be inaccurate.

name: 16 gauge #4
description: The 16 gauge shell is very comparable to the 12 gauge in preformamce. The 16 gauge is lighter and has less recoil, buut it is very seldomly used due to various reasons the one mostly considered is the change to steel loads for waterfowl hunting This is a #4 load which is about the biggest load size one may find in a 16 gauge.

name: 16 gauge hull
description: An empty hull from a 16 Guage round.
